subject: Re: [junit] Not able to run junit test case
msgSnippet: Hi Pradeep, your mixing JUnit 3 and JUnit 4 styled testcases. Either: 1. JUnit 3 style: inherit from TestCase, use your public static suite() method, and use a
messageBody:
Hi Pradeep,

your mixing JUnit 3 and JUnit 4 styled testcases.

Either:
1. JUnit 3 style: inherit from TestCase, use your public static suite()
method, and use a JUnit 3 based runner
2. JUnit 4 style: do NOT inherit from TestCase, use @Test annotation, and
use either JUnit 4 based runner (JUnitCore, or your IDE) or a JUnit 3 runner
with the JUnit4Adapter.

You will get this message, if a runner will NOT found any test methods, e.g.
if you are using a JUnit 3 based runner, and not having any testXXX methods.
Check your IDE which kind of runner your are starting.

HTH, Jochen



On 7/17/06, pradeep_3diitr <pradeep_3diitr@...> wrote:
>
> Hi,
>
> I am getting following error while running a Junit TestCase whose
> format conforms to new style (@Test, etc):
>
> No tests found in org.MyCompany.EmployeeTest
>
> junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: No tests found in
> org.MyCompany.EmployeeTest at
> org.junit.internal.runners.OldTestClassRunner.run
> (OldTestClassRunner.java:35) at junit.framework.JUnit4TestAdapter.run
> (JUnit4TestAdapter.java:32)
>
> I know this is happening because of annotations being used.
>
> Could you please resolve this ASAP.
>
> Following is the TestCase -->
>
> package org.MyCompany;
>
> import org.MyCompany.Employee;
>
> import org.junit.Test;
> import org.junit.runner.RunWith;
> import org.junit.runners.Parameterized;
> import org.junit.runners.Parameterized.Parameters;
> import org.junit.Assert;
> import org.junit.Before;
> import org.junit.After;
> import org.junit.Ignore;
>
> import org.junit.runner.Result;
>
> import java.util.LinkedList;
> import java.util.Iterator;
>
> import junit.framework.JUnit4TestAdapter;
> import junit.framework.TestCase;
>
> public class EmployeeTest extends TestCase
> {
> private Employee satendra;
> private Employee pradeep;
> private Employee sriram;
>
> @Before
> public void setUp()
> {
> satendra = new Employee("Satendra
> Diwedi",30,50000,null);
> pradeep = new Employee("Pradeep
> Yadav",26,30000,satendra);
> sriram = new Employee("Sriram
> Sethumadhavan",26,35000,satendra);
> }
>
> @Test
> public void GetName()
> {
> Assert.assertEquals("Satendra
> Diwedi",satendra.getName());
> Assert.assertEquals("Pradeep Yadav",pradeep.getName
> ());
> }
>
> @Test
> public void getAge()
> {
> Assert.assertEquals(26,sriram.getAge());
> }
>
> @Test
> public void getSalary()
> {
> Assert.assertEquals(30000.0,pradeep.getSalary(),0);
> }
>
> @Test
> public void raiseSalary()
> {
> pradeep.raiseSalary(10);
> Assert.assertEquals(33000.0,pradeep.getSalary(),0);
> }
>
> @Test
> public void getManager()
> {
> Assert.assertSame(satendra,pradeep.getManager());
> }
>
> //@Ignore
> @Test
> public void getSubordinateList()
> {
> LinkedList<Employee> l = satendra.getSubordinateList
> ();
>
> Iterator listIter = l.listIterator();
>
> Employee e;
>
> e = (Employee)listIter.next();
>
> Assert.assertSame(pradeep,e);
>
> e = (Employee)listIter.next();
>
> Assert.assertSame(sriram,e);
> }
>
> @After
> public void tearDown()
> {
> satendra = null;
> sriram = null;
> pradeep = null;
> }
>
> public static junit.framework.Test suite() {
> return new JUnit4TestAdapter(EmployeeTest.class);
> }
>
> }
>
> Regards,
>
> Pradeep
>
>
>
